title: Disciplinary action for violation
context: ยง84-33 Disciplinary action for violation. In addition to any other powers the civil service commission or other authority may have to discipline employees, the civil service commission or authority may reprimand, put on probation, demote, suspend, or discharge an employee found to have violated the code of ethics. [L 1972, c 163, pt of ยง1; am L 1981, c 82, ยง13] Cross References Civil service, merit appeals board, etc., see ยง26-5 and chapter 76.
